form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Risch (for himself, Mr. Marshall, Mr. Paul, Mr. Scott of Florida, Mr. Mullin, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Daines, Mr. Sheehy, Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Hagerty, and Mr. Cruz) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To permanently enact certain appropriations Act restrictions on the use of funds for abortions and involuntary sterilizations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Values Act.

section.header: Permanent enactment of certain general provisions

subsection.text: Section 104(f) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2151b(f)) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Prohibition on use of funds for abortions and involuntary sterilizations
subsection.text: None of the funds authorized to be appropriated or otherwise made available to carry out this Act may be made available—

paragraph.text: to pay for the performance of abortions as a method of family planning or to motivate or coerce any person to practice abortions;
to pay for the performance of involuntary sterilization as a method of family planning or to coerce or provide any financial incentive to any person to undergo sterilizations;
to pay for biomedical research which relates in whole or in part, to methods of, or the performance of, abortions or involuntary sterilization as a means of family planning;
to lobby for or against abortion; or
to any organization or program which, as determined by the President, supports or participates in the management of a program of coercive abortion or involuntary sterilization.

subsection.text: Section 301(b) of the Peace Corps Act (22 U.S.C. 2501a(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Subject to section 614 of the Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2014 (division E of Public Law 113–76; 128 Stat. 227), none of the funds authorized to be appropriated or otherwise made available to carry out this Act may be used to pay for abortions.
